reviews.sentence: Could be a great get a way but not a 4 star hotel. Hotel service was not consistent. I had asked for more towels as my grand kids went swimming and I was giving them a bath but did not get the extra towels until the next day and then no other towels for the third day. I got tried of calling for service. Hallways were dusty. The hotel was doing renovations. Four years prior I stayed 4 days over the holidays and the remodeling was on going at that time too. Better service in 201. Room service was cold and missing items.

Atlanta Hilton downtown. Very disappointing hotel. If you book 3rd party you ca nt use your Hilton rewards card. If you book 3rd party you will get room 1 step above the janitor closet. Sink drain stop did not function. Window shade broken. Room located right above the entrance to hear all the noise outside. It is the furthest of the chain hotels from the downtown section. You can walk through the enclosed crosswalks from one hotel to the next till you finally get to downtown but the crosswalks do not flow. they change floors and locations at each hotel. So why bother. Stay at better location hotel. If you do venture outside to walk the street have plenty of change for the pan handlers. The pictures of this hotel hype the wonderful view. I saw the not so wonderful entrance motel style on 3rd floor. The only saving point for this hotel is the restaurant Nikolais Roof on the top floor. Fantastic restaurant. Fantastic views. But you can always visit Nikolais while staying somewhere else. Parking lot is hard to navigate and seems to need better security. This hotel is a total buzkil for vacationers. Nikolais Roof restaurant Furthest big chain from Coke World Aquarium and downtown area. Most important a feeling of security in the tomb of a parking lot. Maintain the room so all the amenities function as intended.

should have stayed at the Mariot. The view from my room on the 9th floor. It was not up to date at all the money I spent this one night I should and will be spending at the Mariot. Parking was included there also BETTER amenities. There was no vent in the bathrooms a mini fridge and microwave.
Worst stay ever. Slow customer service. Rude people in room service. They basically told me that they did not want to cook me a grilled cheese. Overall worst experience in Hilton history.

Dated property wifi did not work noisy room. The location was OK for what we needed. Service was indifferent overall. Property is dated. Rooms near the elevators are very loud. Starbucks breakfast market tried to give herself a tip on my debit card that I did not authorize. Seems like a party hotel. We stayed over a weekend and our hallway reeked of weed. Unable to use even paid wifi.

Hotel had good ratings but was disappointing. We booked a king room and advised them we would be arriving after 7 pm. When we got there around 8 pm all they had left was a double with two double beds. It did have a gorgeous view of the city but the double was just too small for us. Also was disappointed in the concierge who gave us a map of the area but there was no shopping available and only a few eateries. We were within walking distance to the Aquarium so went there as it was about the only choice except for the Coca Cola museum. Aquarium was better than most. The restaurant called Rays was superb. It was not warm enough to swim in the outdoor pool and there was no hot tub. If these sorts of things do not bother you much then the hotel is okay. We would not recommend it nor stay there again.
Pleasent but different. It was a comfy space with adjustable air and nice amenities. The staff sometimes did not clean room fully.
Hilton Atlanta the world behind me. Location friendly personnel. View was to die forThe price for parking.

Worst hotel stay EVER. I was scheduled to stay here September 9 10. What a horrible stay. First lets start with the hotel this is a 40 year old hotel and I am not sure it has been renovated since it opened. They have renovation schedule any minute now based on notices. The carpet is definitely worn. Both telephones in my room were broken. I told the staff it was never fixed. My safe broke with my belongings in it security came within 15 minutes to unlock it. I wish security was that responsive the remainder of my stay. read on for that. The curtain pull broke as soon as I touched it. There is plaster on the ceiling near the curtain that is falling off. My friend that was travelling with me informed me that he had hair in his bathtub and found a disposable razor on the floor in his bathroom and his toilet would run flush every 15 minutes this I did witness. No refrigerator plastic cups. Apparently we chose to visit on a weekend when there was an electronic dance music show. The hotel was filled with HUNDREDS of tye died unbathed noisy rude 18 20 year olds that packed rooms. The hotel staff should have questioned this when you see hundreds of people checking in and they are carrying their own pillows blanketsindication that they intended to have far more people in the room than linen provided. The first night they returned from the show around 1 am and were noisy. I spoke to the desk staff the next morning and they said there was not anything they could do. I inquired about going to another hotel and was told good luck all the hotels are in the same situation this weekend and are sold out everywhere. The second night they began to return around 1 am again. Congregating in halls and playing music dancing horseplay. I called security twice in a 30 minute period and never saw anyone. At 2 am the real fun began when hundreds of these guests rounded up on every floor balcony and began hooting yelling throwing things down to the lobby from all 25 floors. it was like mardi gras including people throwing up in the hallways. One girl dropped a bunch of whipits in the lobby and the staff helped her pick them up. I went to the front desk and spoke with a young desk staff who stood and continued to twirl his keys on his finger and said sorry there is nothing I can do. I asked about security and he said I will let them know. I asked to speak with a manager and the manager came out and apologized and said he was not sure what they could do but they are trying. I told him I was going to check out. I went to my room and packed and came back and checked out and told them I wanted a full refund. They said they would do that and apologized. 3 other guests also checked out while I was there. The police finally arrived and stood in the lobby which only made them take the parties into the rooms or deeper on the floors and out of the lobby. I sat in the hotel lobby watching this fiasco for 2 more hours. One of the security guards actually came and woke two young men who were NOT part of this group sitting near me because they were sleeping sitting up in chairs in the lobby. She told them they can stay but they are not permitted to sleep in the lobby. This seemed ridiculous as they were very well mannered and sleeping where we were unable to sleep in our rooms because of the chaos. I never saw this security guard approach any of the partyers in that two hour period. I walked across the street to the Mariot where it seems they had a very quiet evening and almost no one in the lobby. After the first night the hotel staff and security should have been better prepared to deal with this and the hotel management should have been better prepared to deal with the customers complaints more professionally. I am a Hilton honors member and can not believe this is a Hilton property. and by the way as a member there were no extra amenities such as bottled water etc. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Not worth the rates outdated rooms. I was very disappointed in the quality of room for the location of downtown Atlanta. The lobby was beautiful and exterior but the room need major upgrading. The bathroom was small and outdated with paint chipping above the shower with the tub appearance very old looking. The mattress was very hard and the bed had small throw pillows instead of full size pillows. I will never return.

Room was dirty upon arrival. Food Burger and fries tasted good but by time it arrived to my room itwas cold. Nice size room for king size bed. My initial inspection of the room was not very good. The bathroom wasdirty. There was dirt and other peoples hair in the tub. The toiletwas dirty nasty. There were body excremate stains and body hair frompast occupants still on the toilet seat and under the seat. I called thefront desk to ask for someone to come up to clean bathtom. The firstmaid did a half ass job and it smelled of lemon fresh urine. I caledfor the manager after she left the room. He came to the room and showedhim the toilet. He also smelled the scent. The second maid Atetomcameup with bleach and cleaned the bathroom again. The bed pillows andshets needed to be changed again due to other peoples hair andstains on bedding. Just did not feel comfortable until it wascleaned and bedding was changed. The hotel looked full since colegekids and alumni were all over the place so I did not ask for anotherom. Management really need to inspected the rooms more closely. Itsunaceptable to 300 for a room that was not really cleaned until theocupant arrived and noticed the deficiencies.
Easy check in and check out. Great room temperature and tv. The gym was big enough to accommodate all guests. Gym equipment was modern. Executive breakfast was nice with all the fresh fruit.

Great Hotel and Excellent Service in the Heart of Downtown Atlanta. I was greeted pleasantly checked into my room efficiently and early and had a wonderful stay. The entire staff was helpful and friendly and the amenities of the Executive floor were top notch. Highly recommended.

Excellent. Pretty much everyone was nice as the could possibly be. Our room was really nice and decent sized. I was not told before hand we would have to pay for parking for our location or about a deposit that was taken out of my account when we checked in to the hotel. I called downstairs immediately to see why so much money was taken out and was sent to leave a message. Not one person called me back in the 3 days we were there. Then I was told it would take about 5 days to get my money back. The lady at the desk was kind of rude when I asked about it and kind of slammed my receipt on the counter.
Great location in downtown Atlanta clean rooms excellent staff all around great staff. Definitely will be staying here again.

Jump at Hilton Atlanta. We stayed at the Hilton Downtown Atlanta for the Jump convention the room were nice clean and comfortable. The staff was very good computers went down at the Starbucks which caused a huge line at the Starbucks which moved slowly. Everyone checked out at the same time which caused mayhem at the elevators.

A week in Atlanta at Hilton Atlanta. The first night was a challenge due to the fact the room we selected was not what we recieved. Luckliy we recieved a better room the next day and the change in service from night to day was huge. Overall i am glad we stayed. I would recommend this hotel to those on business trips. Honeymooners make sure you get a room on the 20th floor or higher.
Front desk staff was unenthused. DONT valet. It takes forever. Self park for half the cost. Save the time and money. Otherwise the cleaning staff was very friendly and room was nice.

Great place to stay in Downtown Atlanta. Recently visited Atlanta for the SEC Championship game and this was a great place to stay. Jordan at the front desk was very friendly and was fun to visit with upon check in. The location was great and it was very easy to get to the stadium and other places we visited. The room was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast at Nikolais Roof was great. Everyone we came in contact with at the hotel was very friendly. Thanks to everyone at the Hilton Atlanta for making this a great visit. Highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Room air problems. I had air conditioning issues in my room and the technician they sent “ Joshua ” was amazingHe was very personable and fixed it really quickly. He took the time to chat and you do n’t find that often with the technicians at hotels. You could tell he enjoyed his job. Kudos to Joshua for turning a warm situation into a joyful one.
